abstract: For years, those in a rural Texas village cherished living among nature and wildlife. Elon Musk’s SpaceX has brought new fears and the promise of an economic boost to one of America’s poorest corners.
byLine: By Edgar Sandoval and Richard Webner
title: A Serene Shore Resort, Except for the SpaceX ‘Ball of Fire’

fullImage.copyright: Christopher Lee for The New York Times

largeThumb.copyright: Christopher Lee for The New York Times

abstract: Hospitals in Ireland, New Zealand and Scripps Health in San Diego are reeling from digital extortion attacks.
byLine: By Nicole Perlroth and Adam Satariano
title: Irish Hospitals Are Latest to Be Hit by Ransomware Attacks

fullImage.caption: Naas General Hospital in County Kildare, Ireland. The country’s health system has been hobbled for a week by a ransomware attack.
fullImage.copyright: Niall Carson/Press Association, via Associated Press

largeThumb.caption: Naas General Hospital in County Kildare, Ireland. The country’s health system has been hobbled for a week by a ransomware attack.

abstract: Multiple missions, combined with years of record disasters, have strained the agency — and scientists predict an unusually severe disaster season ahead.
byLine: By Christopher Flavelle and Zolan Kanno-Youngs
title: Facing Hurricane and Wildfire Seasons, FEMA Is Already Worn Out

fullImage.caption: Rescue personnel searched debris and destroyed buildings in the aftermath of Hurricane Michael in Mexico Beach, Fla., in 2018.

largeThumb.caption: Rescue personnel searched debris and destroyed buildings in the aftermath of Hurricane Michael in Mexico Beach, Fla., in 2018.

abstract: Storms, floods, wildfires and to a lesser degree, conflict, uprooted millions globally in 2020 — the largest human displacement in more than a decade.
title: Even Amid a Pandemic, More Than 40 Million People Fled Their Homes

abstract: The forecast, which follows a record season in 2020, arrives as hurricanes are becoming more destructive over time.
title: Scientists Predict an ‘Above Normal’ Atlantic Hurricane Season

abstract: How the latest violence between Israelis and Palestinians encapsulates the best and worst of digital life.
title: An Old Conflict With Digital Twists

abstract: Invasive species could cost the agricultural sector more than $3.5 trillion across the continent, a new study estimated.
title: Intruder Pests May Drain Trillions From Africa’s Economies, Study Finds

fullImage.caption: A farmer near Sokoto in northwestern Nigeria. Corn, cassava and tomatoes have been hit hard by invasive species on the continent.

largeThumb.caption: A farmer near Sokoto in northwestern Nigeria. Corn, cassava and tomatoes have been hit hard by invasive species on the continent.

abstract: While on a college field trip to collect beetles, he found salamanders. He became an authority and later grew alarmed by the disappearance of many amphibians.
title: David Wake, Expert on Salamanders and Evolution, Dies at 84

fullImage.caption: The biologist David Wake with a jar of preserved salamanders in the 1970s. “If you sat down to dinner with him,” a former student said, “he would talk about and describe salamanders and you’d want to drop everything to go with him.”

largeThumb.caption: The biologist David Wake with a jar of preserved salamanders in the 1970s. “If you sat down to dinner with him,” a former student said, “he would talk about and describe salamanders and you’d want to drop everything to go with him.”

abstract: Dr. Wu Lien-Teh helped change the course of a plague epidemic in the early 20th century and promoted the use of masks as a public health tool.
title: What Can and Can’t Be Learned From a Doctor in China Who Pioneered Masks

abstract: At the redesigned Allison and Roberto Mignone Halls of Gems and Minerals, which opens June 12, the evolution of minerals is front and center.

abstract: The time to debate the power of voice technology is now. (Before Alexa starts suggesting comfort foods.)

abstract: With a changing climate, fires in far northern forests that smolder throughout winter and erupt again in spring could become more common, a new study suggests.
title: Blazes That Refuse to Die: ‘Zombie Fires’
